Help:Node.title: page
Help:Node.Log:Description:
COMMAND USAGE: @page [player] "[message]"
EXAMPLE: @page StoryBuilder Death "Thanks for the help"
Sends an instant message to the named player if they are currently logged in.
{? | $(System:Config.Base:Pages:Global) |In $(theatre.gamebrief) pages are turned on for all users. Whenever you receive a page from another player, you must consent to receive it, using the command @PAGE ACCEPT [PLAYER] or @PAGE DENY [PLAYER].
You may also permanently add someone to your page consent list, using @PAGE ALLOW [PLAYER] or take them off using @PAGE UNALLOW [PLAYER]. Conversely you may add someone to your page denial list using @PAGE BLOCK [PLAYER] or remove them using @PAGE UNBLOCK [PLAYER]. Finally, if you are too busy too accept pages, just type @PAGE BUSY ON. Remember to set @PAGE BUSY OFF later.
| In $(theatre.gamebrief) players may only send pages to StoryHosts and other StoryTellers. If you are seeking help, you should first use the @ASSIST command.
SEE ALSO:
}
